name: Wielopole Hotel

reviews.text: This place was OK, despite the difficulties associated with the current building works. The Reception area was very pleasant and the staff helpful. However, having read many of the Trip Advisor reviews, I have to say that I found the rest of the hotel was a little depressing. My room was dingy and poky and the bedding woefully inadaqute, even in September.
reviews.title: Reception and Staff very pleasant

reviews.text: The dining room was fairly grim and the breakfast unspeakably poor. I'm sure that the hotel staff try their best, but to me the place was certainly not like the highly praised establishment that I had expected.
reviews.title: Wielepole - Fantastic location. Excellent value for money

likes.disliked: — Busy breakfast room, not enough staff

reviews.title: Problems with Stay in Wielopole
reviews.text: After reading the reviews already for this hotel, we had mixed feelings when we arrived.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We neednt really have worried. The location of the hotel was FANTASTIC, and you really couldnt have had a better spot without paying 3 times as much money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!111
reviews.title: ideal situation

reviews.text: The hotel reception had fresh coffee and tea and polish biscuits all laid out, so we sat on the leather sofa in reception and made ourselves at home. Check in was easy and reception staff polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Good Value and Central Location

reviews.text: No working AC. Room was consistently 85+++ degrees with the windows open. And because you had to leave the windows open, the traffic and shrieks of twenty something party-goers was heard all night long. Especially since many of them appeared friendly with the very young night reception staff at the Wielopole and would stop by to shriek and giggle at 3 in the morning. I was NOT PLEASED. I kind of value being able to sleep. Day staff was consistently better, but night staff apparently view their job as a place to hang out with their friends. I forgot to mention that when I checked in, past midnight, the female receptionist had to be summoned from a back hallway bathroom, and was followed a few seconds later by a young man in street clothes who headed straight for the front door and out. I'll leave it to your imagination as to what they were doing while I waited tired and ready for a room. I recommend trying the Holiday Inn directly across the street. Location is equally good, and as I took tours from that place, I can attest their AC was working, and the staff always appeared professional, courteous and over 19.
reviews.title: Night Reception is a Nightmare

likes.disliked: — The lack of AC and the noise from outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wielopole is located 3 blocks from the main square, a very good site. The rooms are adequate size, well appointed and clean. Bathroom has a shower (no tub), is large and clean. Staff is efficient and helpful. Breakfast is not included, cost is about $7. Elevator for upper floors. Tote your own bags. This is a 3 star hotel so expectations should not be too high. Nevertheless, it was just fine for our needs. We arrived very early in the AM on a night train from Pargue. The hotel stored our bags and had the room ready at about 1PM. A good choice for convenience and value.
reviews.title: Hotel Wielopole in Krakow
Great hotel in great location
reviews.text: I booked at Hotel Wielopole based on Trip Advisor reviews, and I have not been disappointed! Friendly and professional staff, clean and spacious rooms, and very well located - a 3 minute walk into the old town. I am very happy and will stay here again next time I am in Krakow, and would strongly recommend it to anyone looking for reasonably priced and excellent accomodation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to Krakow by train early in the morning and walked to the hotel. It was a 10 min walk and our room was ready which was great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They issue everyday a newsletter of what is going on in the city with addresses of restaurants, club/bars to go and also a weather forecast for the next two days. Nice touch. The rooms are simple but you honestly do not need more. Not noisy, complimentary water and cookies in the room. The bathroom was very clean and the pressure in the shower was absolutely great... well needed after a long night train. Perfect location to catch bus to a Salt mine trip (just on the corner) and 5 min walk to the Old town (Rynek). Overall, great value for the price. Will stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price !

likes.liked: — the Shower and the everyday newsletter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a quick 10-minute walk from the central train station which is also next to the Galeria Krakowska (mall) The hotel itself is in an old building with updated interior/amenities including elevator and double insulated windows. Staff is friendly and English speaking. The location is excellent, a short walk to old town, the castle, and to the trolleys (which we did not use) Internet access is available in the lobby. The Holiday Inn is directly across the street.
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.disliked: — No carpet in hallways = noise. AC did not work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was pleasant and helpful. The hotel is in a great location. We had a quiet room, access was easy, breakfast was excellent. We never had to wait for a table, and the food was great. Our only suggestion would be to brighten up the room a little with some artwork on the walls, and a little better lighting. The curtains are too thin and don't darken the room well. Overall though, it was great value and a good experience.
reviews.title: Lovely stay in the Wielopole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i have just returned from a great holiday in Poland. during our holiday we stayed three nights at the wielopole guest rooms. we choose this hotel because of the good reviews we read on "trip advisor" my advice to you all is do not stay at this property. yes the rooms were clean and the staff helpful and friendly, the breakfast ok, its just that for very little extra you can do so much better. on holiday its the little things that make all the difference and these were lacking at this accommodation. our room was too small and this was even after being offered an alternative. the air conditioning was inadequate and when you turned that of and opened the window the street too noisy. i repeat do not stay here while visiting the wonderful city of Krakow.
reviews.title: disappointed
Wielopole Guest Rooms
reviews.text: We stayed there 24-28 July. Found it very convenient for main square - about 5 mins walk with one busy junction to cross. Staff were young and very helpful, language no problem as at least one one each shift spoke English. Rooms seemed to have been renovated recently and were not big but large enough and very clean. Bathrooms were large with excellent shower, no bath. AC worked well as did averything else. Breakfasts a good choice of hot and cold and at 20 zlotys good value. We were at the front and did not have the problems other guests have reported of the sun waking us up through the curtains. Would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice little hotel in convenient location just a short walk to the market square. The room was clean and as our room was at the back of the hotel we were not bothered by any noise. The room was rather hot but this was probably due to a heatwave - not the normal temperature expected in July. Staff were friendly. Breakfast room is in the basement. The continental breakfast is around £4 and is well stocked with a variety of meats, cheeses, breads, yogurts, fruit, cereal etc. Would definately recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Krakow as we had no complaints and it was very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Good location, clean and tidy

reviews.text: I travelled to Krakow for a friends birthday weekend. I had a few reservations about the hotel when we arrived because the taxi driver had never heard of it, however i was proved totally wrong.
reviews.title: Great Value For Money!!!
Great location for bargain hotel
reviews.text: Good size room on 4th floor looking straight at the Holiday Inn across the road. Very clean and great shower in decent size bathroom. Air conditioning which was very important in the hot weather. Only problem was the curtains which were far too thin so the room was virtually light from about 4a.m. Having read about this from a previous review we took eye masks so were able to overcome the issue.
Very good breakfast - would take issue with the reviewer who described it as average - heaven knows what he expected1
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb with 3 of the major tourist areas some 10 minutes walk to each
reviews.title: Reasonabley priced and very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very friendly and helpful
reviews.title: Just Braw

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay and had a lovely time. We found the breakfasts very good - fruit, cereals, juices, cold platter and cakes. The staff are very polite and helpful. The rooms are clean and bathrooms spotless. Beds OK & requested extra pillows.
reviews.title: OK Hotel, good location, but not luxury.

description: True Polish hospitality, European standard, comfort in the most elegant fashion, pleasant atmosphere and cordial staff – Wielopole in a discreet and successful way combines all these advantages and wins the recognition of customers from all over the world.
